intro: Pierotia reticulata, commonly known as the nettleleaf mallow, is a flowering plant belonging to the Malvaceae family. It is characterized by its hairy, lobed leaves that give it a distinctive appearance. The plant produces showy, pink to purple flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It is native to regions of southern Africa and thrives in well-drained soils. Pierotia reticulata is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is relatively easy to grow in gardens.
